title: Aileen Fyfe - Referees, Editors, and Printers in the Making of Scientific Knowledge
description: Why is journal publication so important in the history of science, and how are they responsible for the making of scientific knowledge? In this lecture, Aileen Fyfe reveals the story behind the pages of the oldest scientific journal in existence, the Philosophic Transactions of the Royal Society.
content:encoded: Why is journal publication so important in the history of science, and how are they responsible for the making of scientific knowledge? In this lecture, Aileen Fyfe reveals the story behind the pages of the oldest scientific journal in existence, the Philosophic Transactions of the Royal Society.
itunes:subtitle: Dr Aileen Fyfe (St Andrews) discusses the history of making and communicating scientific knowledge in the course of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries
